intro: Astragalus newberryi var. wardianus, commonly known as the Wardian milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in nutrient-poor soils. Its flowers are often pink to reddish in color, and it produces small, hairy pods that contain seeds.
